explanation: S = nCr(52,5), combinations with one club = nCr(52-13,4) = nCr(39,4). 1 - (nCr(39,4)/nCr(52,5)) = 64531/66640
instructions: A 5-card hand is dealt from a perfectly shuffled deck of playing cards. What is the probability of each of the following events?
question:
(a)

The hand has at least one club.
section: Exercise 5.6.4: The probability of events -  5-card hands.
